alert.note: Alert for Chase; Marion; McPherson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 11:21PM CDT until July 04 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern McPherson County in central Kansas... Chase County in east central Kansas... Marion County in central Kansas... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1121 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dunlap to 7 miles southeast of Durham to 5 miles southwest of Windom, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...50 to 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Marion, Moundridge, Inman, Peabody, Cottonwood Falls, Canton, Strong City, Florence, Goessel, Burns, Lincolnville, Lehigh, Bazaar, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Hymer, Marion Lake and Wonsevu. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 44 and 56. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 97 and 115. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
